headline: Kirkwood Pulse • November 01, 2025
overview:
project_overview:
  developer: Double Eagle Development
  location: Former Public Works site, Kirkwood
  housing_units: 202
  building_details: Six four-story buildings
  parking_spots: 247
  new_through_street: Connecting Taylor to Fillmore through the site
  zoning: Proposed new R-7 Planned Multifamily zoning for approval process
amenities_and_features:
  homes: Ranch and townhome layouts with covered direct entry front porches and private attached garages
  community_amenities: Pool, fitness center, lounge, grill stations, professionally maintained grounds
  design: Architectural elements reflecting historic Kirkwood homes with modern features
  pedestrian_friendly: Streets and sidewalks with gathering spaces, art installations, and robust landscaping
criticisms_and_concerns:
  absence_of_hotel: No hotel included despite original RFP requirement
  lack_of_retail: No ground-floor retail allowed under new zoning, seen as a missed opportunity for neighborhood businesses and trail users
  building_design: Six blocky, mostly identical buildings lacking human scale
  parking: Extensive surface parking reminiscent of suburban developments, limiting potential for communal spaces like a town square
  development_phasing: Preference for smaller phased developments by multiple entities to create diverse visions
  approval_process: Confusion over why it took a year for Council to select this proposal
  financial_details: Unclear how much revenue the city will gain to offset the $12 million spent on the site
positive_notes:
  -: New through street improves connectivity and walkability in Downtown Kirkwood
outlook: Project details and financial terms remain uncertain; further updates expected.

items.title: 202 Homes Proposed for Former Public Works Site
items.excerpt: Well folks, after nearly a year of waiting, the results of the Request for Proposals on the former Public Works site have finally surfaced via this week’s Planning & Zoning agenda. The selected proposal comes from St. Louis-based Double Eagle Development and calls for 202 homes across six four-story buildings, accompanied by 247 parking spots. Double Eagle’s description of the
